data.title: Graphics artifact when scrolling through intellisense list
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Start typing to bring up intellisense
2. Use arrow keys to scroll down.

I'm seeing some line artifacts in the list. It might be hard to see, wondering if anyone can repro.
![intellisenseartifact](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12900364/14801042/3c2dde6a-0afb-11e6-962d-1ed906750753.PNG)

It only happens when scrolling down quickly but they do stay visible after I stop scrolling. If I scroll back up they disappear.

data.title: Come up with better external terminal defaults on Linux
data.body:
Currently the default is `x-terminal-emulator` unless the OS is not Debian and is gnome in which case it's `gnome-terminal`. This could be cleaned up and improved to add common non-gnome terminals, something like this:

```
if is debian
  x-terminal-emulator
if is gnome or gnome-classic
  gnome-terminal
if is other common cases
  some good default
fallback to a reasonable default widely supported? `xterm`?
```

/cc @pflannery

data.title: VSCode fails to process paths with back slashes returned from debug adapter
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Windows 10 64-bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a debug server that responds to the 'launch' request by sending a response with 'path' containing back slashes 
2. VSCode shows error and the debug session is terminated.

Above is inconsistent because the 'program' field sent by VSCode contains path with back slashes.

2. Open command palette (F1)

data.title: Intellisense is extremely slow to load
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX Yosemite 10.10.5
- Unity Version: 4.6.9f1
- VSCode Unity Plugin: 2.50-RELEASE

I set up VSCode with Unity by following the guide here: https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/runtimes/unity

When using VSCode everything works great, the only problem is that intellisense takes many minutes to load when ever I do a single line of change. Reference counts go away. Autocomplete stops working. Jumping to declarations don't do anything, then it will jump to the declaration about 5 minutes after I clicked the action. Just hitting enter to start typing on a new line messes everything up.

How can I speed up load times for this? Did I set something up wrong?

Mono should be up to date. I updated dnvm stuff suggested by some stackoverflow post. When I do 'dnvm list' on terminal, I get this:

```
Active Version              Runtime Architecture OperatingSystem Alias
------ -------              ------- ------------ --------------- -----
       1.0.0-rc1-update2    coreclr x64          darwin          
  *    1.0.0-rc1-update2    mono                 linux/osx       default
```

I don't get any actual errors. I will get a message when ever I make a change saying, "Some projects had trouble loading. Please review the output for more details." The omnisharp log for this is:

```
[INFO] Starting OmniSharp at 'PROJECTPATH/client-csharp.sln'...
[INFO] Started OmniSharp from '/Users/KingKlong/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-0.3.7/bin/omnisharp' with process id 91421...
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.Startup] Omnisharp server running using stdio at location 'PROJECTPATH' on host 90813.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.Dnx.DnxPaths] Using runtime '/Users/KingKlong/.dnx/runtimes/dnx-mono.1.0.0-rc1-update2'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.Dnx.DnxProjectSystem] Scanning 'PROJECTPATH' for DNX projects
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.Dnx.DnxProjectSystem] No project.json based projects found
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Detecting projects in 'PROJECTPATH/client-csharp.sln'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Loading project from 'PROJECTPATH/Assembly-CSharp-firstpass-vs.csproj'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Loading project from 'PROJECTPATH/Assembly-CSharp-vs.csproj'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Loading project from 'PROJECTPATH/Assembly-CSharp-Editor-firstpass-vs.csproj'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.MSBuild.MSBuildProjectSystem] Loading project from 'PROJECTPATH/Assembly-CSharp-Editor-vs.csproj'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.ScriptCs.ScriptCsProjectSystem] Detecting CSX files in 'PROJECTPATH'.
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.ScriptCs.ScriptCsProjectSystem] Could not find any CSX files
[INFORMATION:OmniSharp.Startup] Solution has finished loading
```

Also, the flame icon on the bottom right corner says "0 projects". When I click on it, it lists two .sln files. One is client.sln . The other is client-csharp.sln. When I click either of them, they seem to work the same. The flame icon will still say "0 projects" after I click either of them. The guide says to click the -csharp one, but other stackoverflow posts say to choose the other. Which one should I be clicking?

data.title: Highlight HTML/CSS/JS in different language
data.body:
I'm not sure if this is already possible but the documentation seems scarce about how to do this. I created a Language extension for the Smarty templating language. This has a special tag called `literal` which when used should show the natural syntax highlighting. Currently this doesn't work at all and greys out a lot of the "literal" code. 

Is there a way to do what the tag is intending in VSCode? Also see my attached images to see how VSCode handles it vs Netbeans.

![7caf2742-0311-11e6-906d-610bb6967c54](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/481144/14794612/fe747f82-0af2-11e6-8bba-31bc66ba701a.jpg)
![dbc99042-0310-11e6-88c0-e9eeccdfcc50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/481144/14794613/fe78f44a-0af2-11e6-8169-e98e84a5dce4.jpg)

data.title: Debug console does not allow empty input string to be executed
data.body:
In PowerShell, it's fairly common for the user to press Enter in response to a prompt on the screen.  For example, there could be a prompt for the user's choice which allows a default value to be accepted by pressing Enter.  There's also the scenario where the user might be asked for a string of input where an empty string may be valid or indicate the use of a default.

Could the debug console allow empty inputs to be sent to the debug adapter?  Sending it across as a null or empty string would be fine.

Thanks!

---
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install the PowerShell extension
2. Open workspace path `c:\Users\<yourusername>\.vscode\extensions\ms-vscode.PowerShell-0.5.0\examples`
3. Select file `DebugTest.ps1` and press F5
4. Pause the debugger while executing
5. In the Debug Console, execute the following line `Read-Host -Prompt "Enter a string"`
6. When the prompt is displayed, try to press Enter or press the spacebar and then press Enter.
7. Observe that the prompt does not proceed.  Only after typing a non-empty string can the prompt be completed.

data.title: Using VS Code as a git mergetool
data.body:
1.0.0 introduced the ability to use VS Code as a git difftool. The relevant global `.gitconfig` lines are as follows:

```
[diff]
    tool = default-difftool
[difftool "default-difftool"]
    cmd = code --wait --diff $LOCAL $REMOTE
```

How can I use VS Code as a git [mergetool](https://www.git-scm.com/docs/git-mergetool)?

The relevant arguments it needs to accept, I believe, are `$LOCAL`, `$REMOTE`, `$BASE`, and `$MERGED`.

data.title: Debugging mocha breakpoints not working right and value inspector not showing right info.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: 10.11.4

Using mocha, es6 and chai with vs code does not debug properly.
1. Breakpoints in tests do not work properly, they may fire but in wrong place.
2. Value inspector does not show local variables defined using let
3. Debugging ES6 files, local variables do not show nor can you view values of function parameters.

Steps to Reproduce:

See attached file.

set breakpoint in calc.js.
when breakpoint hits and you hover over it shows nothing.
typing "value1" in the console states undefined.

set breakpoint in test that will call the calc function, a breakpoint hits but not on breakpoint position.
also can not see local values.
[test.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/234769/test.zip)

@chrisdias Chris, please complete the test plan item...

data.title: Test JSHint new features
data.body:
- [x] @waderyan

We recently updated the jshint extension with extends and exclude support as described in the extensions ReadMe.md file.

No cross-platform testing required. A single platform suffices.

data.title: Test TS lint new features
data.body:
- [x] @jrieken 

TSLint has added the following new settings:
- tslint.ignoreDefinitionFiles - control if TypeScript definition files should be ignored.
- tslint.exclude - configure glob patterns of file paths to exclude from linting.
- tslint.validateWithDefaultConfig - validate a file for which there was no custom tslint confguration found. The default is false.

Newer versions of tslint introduced the regression that changes to the tslint.json were no longer automatically applied.  Therefore, test that changes to the tslint.json are automatically applied.

For testing use the latest tslint version 3.8.1

data.title: Test notify Linux user when a new update is available
data.body:
- [x] @aeschli
- [x] @seanmcbreen 

Linux users should now get update notifications in the workbench. An easy way to trigger this is to open your installed Code's `product.json`, change the commit to anything other than the current value and restart. The `Update` action should also appear in the `About` menu, although it'll only open a browser, in case there is an update available.

data.title: Emmet: support to disable expansion on TAB
data.body: The setting `emmet.triggerExpansionOnTab` allows to control whether emmet should be triggered on `tab`.

data.title: Test add onDebug activation event
data.body:
- [x] win @kieferrm 
- [x] mac @jrieken 
- [x] linux @bpasero 

https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/3059
Upon starting a debug session we now emit a 'onDebug:{type}' event, e.g 'onDebug:node'. Take the extension starter and modify it to be activated on the 'onDebug' event. Verify your extension gets activated on debug start.

data.title: Use minimist for argv handling
data.body: cc @bpasero

data.title: Test: JSON completion for package.json and bower.json
data.body:
Test plan for 'Push hard coded JSON schema support into extensions'
- [x] @joaomoreno 
- [x] @bgashler1 

In package.json, bower.json and project.json we offer completion and hover in the dependency sections.
Until now, that code was located in the JSON extension. I added new supports so that we can move that code to the extensions they belong, so that the corresponding owners can maintain them.
- bower.json & package.json are now in the JavaScript extension
- project.json will be in the omnisharp extension. The pull request with the change has been filed, but omnisharp is currently code frozen and we have to wait until their stream is open again. So for now there's no need to test project.json.

package.json:
1. Open a package.json 
2. in a dependency section ("dependencies", "devDependencies", "peerDependencies", "optionalDependencies") try completions and hovers. Try completing package names as well as versions. Complete in the middle of existing dependencies, or at the end, with a leading quote or without.

bower.json
1. Open a bower.json 
2. in a dependency section ("dependencies", "devDependencies") try completions and hovers. Try completing package names as well as versions. Complete in the middle of existing dependencies, or at the end, with a leading quote or without.

data.title: debt - storage service shouldn't be an event emitter
data.body: It should use the new explicit events like config [now](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/8be19782ff7cab1c88e9770581102082fe20cb48) does. Tho then I am unsure if the StorageService eventing is used by anyone at all.
